findings.title: Predictable random number using blockhash and timestamp
findings.explanation: The contract sets `answer` using keccak256(block.blockhash(block.number - 1), now), both of which are predictable on-chain values. An attacker can compute the same hash after deployment and trivially guess the number to drain the contract.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a secure source of randomness, such as an external oracle or a commit–reveal scheme, instead of relying on blockhash or timestamp.
